actionUnits.condition: MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 254571545) in scene is the CheckElements script (guid: 3bc2acd74545a4f1aa9eba6d8f72a530), attached to GameObject fileID 254571543. It exposes a public no-arg method AddElementInSocket that increments internal count and, when numberOfElementsInSocket == numberOfElements (3), invokes UnityEvents: hideTaskDescription -> GameObject(fileID 1945735948).SetActive(false), showNextLevelUI -> GameObject(fileID 208823133).SetActive(true), unlock -> GameObject(fileID 157114427).SetActive(false). Canvas refs nextLevelUI(fileID 208823134) and taskDescription(fileID 1945735953) are present. Object has no Rigidbody, so we trigger the script method directly.

MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 680431495) on Box_02 is XRSocketInteractor (guid: 60523e0647cc6ab43acc73cb266a32a7). It has UnityEvent m_Calls: m_HoverEntered -> Renderer(fileID 680431493).set_enabled(false); m_SelectEntered -> CheckElements(fileID 254571545).AddElementInSocket(); m_SelectExited -> CheckElements(fileID 254571545).AddElementInSocket(). The parent GameObject '5- Box Sockets Interactors' has MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 254571545) which is CheckElements (guid: 3bc2acd74545a4f1aa9eba6d8f72a530) with numberOfElements=3 and UnityEvents: hideTaskDescription -> GameObject(1945735948).SetActive(false), showNextLevelUI -> GameObject(208823133).SetActive(true), unlock -> GameObject(157114427).SetActive(false). Since Box_02 has no Rigidbody and we lack a selectable Interactable to naturally fire XR events, we manually invoke AddElementInSocket three times to simulate one SelectEntered and one SelectExited plus an additional selection to meet the threshold.

Canvas refs: nextLevelUI(fileID 208823134), taskDescription(fileID 1945735953). Box_02 (3) has no Rigidbody; we directly trigger the public no-arg method to simulate the select events.
